example.name: ADC Example 1
example.desc: Continuously poll one ADC channel for a new value and write the value to the UART interface.

example.name: ADC Example 2
example.desc: Setup in an interrupt on the ADC and write the value to the UART interface when it changes.

example.name: ADC Example 3
example.desc: Continuously poll multiple ADC channels and periodically write the values to the UART interface.

example.name: ADC Example 4
example.desc: Obtain ADC channel reading in single shot more and write the values to the UART interface.

example.name: ADC Example 5
example.desc: Obtain ADC channel reading with an interrupt in single shot more and write the values to the UART interface.

example.name: BCD Example 1
example.desc: Display the type of BCD charging port that the device is connected to.

example.name: Camera Example 1
example.desc: Demonstrates how to interface with the camera sensor and I2C control lines.

example.name: CAN Example 1
example.desc: Transmit CAN messages between CAN0 and CAN1 and poll for the response.

example.name: CAN Example 2
example.desc: Transmit CAN messages from CAN0 and show they can be filtered on CAN1.

example.name: CAN Example 3
example.desc: Transmit CAN messages and revieve and process using interrupts.

group.name: D2XX Examples
group.desc: Implement an FTDI D2XX Device on the USB Device.

example.name: D2XX Example 1
example.desc: Configure and enumerate as a D2XX device with data loopback.

example.name: D2XX Example UART Bridge
example.desc: Enumerate as a D2XX device and bridge data to and from the UART interface.

example.name: DAC Example 1
example.desc: Perform a series of single-shot DAC conversions.

example.name: DAC Example 2
example.desc: Setup in a DAC in continuous mode and poll to send new data.

example.name: DAC Example 3
example.desc: Setup in a DAC in continuous mode and use an interrupt to send new data.

example.name: DLOG Example
example.desc: Demonstrate use of the datalogger API.

example.name: Ethernet Example 1
example.desc: Implementing ARP and ICMP Echo support to allow the device to respond to a "ping".

example.name: FreeRTOS Example 1
example.desc: Run a series of tasks using queues, switching with the pre-emptive scheduler.

example.name: FreeRTOS Example 2
example.desc: Run a series of tasks using queues, semaphores, events and priority assignment.

example.name: FreeRTOS Example 3
example.desc: Run a series of tasks using time slicing, pre-emptive scheduling using a mutex.

example.name: FreeRTOS Example 4
example.desc: Run a series of tasks demonstrating FreeRTOS kernel aware debugging.

example.name: FreeRTOS D2XX Example
example.desc: Within FreeRTOS, configure and enumerate as a D2XX device with data loopback.

example.name: FreeRTOS lwIP Example
example.desc: Use lwIP (lightweight IP stack) from FreeRTOS to perform Ethernet networking.

group.name: GPIO Examples
group.desc: Show how the GPIO Interface can be used.

example.name: GPIO Example 1
example.desc: Set the state of a GPIO output through polling.

example.name: GPIO Example 2
example.desc: Monitor the state of a GPIO input through polling.

example.name: GPIO Example 3
example.desc: Monitor the state of a GPIO input by interrupts.

example.name: GPIO DFU Example
example.desc: Enable the device to enter USB DFU mode when signalled by a GPIO.

group.name: I2C Examples
group.desc: Send and Receive Data on the I2C Interfaces.

example.name: I2C Master Example 1
example.desc: Send and receive data to an externally connected I2C slave device.

example.name: I2C Master Example 2
example.desc: Send and receive data to an 24AA02E48T device. MM900EVx boards with Ethernet will have this device.

example.name: I2C Slave Example 1
example.desc: Reveive and reply to an I2C master device.

group.name: I2S Examples
group.desc: Send and Receive Data on the I2C Interfaces.

example.name: I2S Master Example 1
example.desc: Send a block of data to a codec. MM900EVx boards as fitted with a Wolfram WM8731 Codec.

example.name: I2S Master Example 2
example.desc: Send and receive data to and from a codec. MM900EVx boards as fitted with a Wolfram WM8731 Codec.

group.name: PWM Examples
group.desc: Genreate Waveforms on the PWM Interfaces.

example.name: PWM Example 1
example.desc: Output a fixed duty cycle waveform.

example.name: PWM Example 2
example.desc: Output a variable duty cycle waveform.

example.name: PWM Example 3
example.desc: Output audible frequencies on the PWM.

example.name: RTC Example 1
example.desc: Internal RTC. Display the elapsed time recorded by the RTC.

example.name: RTC Example 2
example.desc: Internal RTC. Demonstrate time matching on the RTC.

example.name: RTC External Example 1
example.desc: Extenal RTC on MM900EVx boards. Display time and elapsed time recorded by the RTC.

example.name: RTC External Example 2
example.desc: Extenal RTC on MM900EVx boards. Demonstrate time matching on the RTC.

group.name: SD Host Example
group.desc: Examples for the SD Card reader.

example.name: SD Host Example 1
example.desc: Reads a filesystem on an SD card. Writes, reads and deletes a file.

group.name: SPI Examples
group.desc: Send and Receive Data on the SPI Interfaces.

example.name: SPI Master Example 1
example.desc: Send and receive data from an SPI device.

example.name: SPI Master Example 2
example.desc: Send and receive data from an SPI device using a FIFO buffer.

example.name: SPI Master Example 3
example.desc: Send and receive data from an SPI device using 4-bit mode.

example.name: SPI Slave Example 1
example.desc: Reveive and reply to an SPI master device.

example.name: Timer Example 1
example.desc: Demonstrate multiple times using single-shot mode.

example.name: Timer Example 2
example.desc: Demonstrate multiple times using continuous mode.

example.name: Timer Example 3
example.desc: Demonstrate multiple times using continuous mode and being serviced by an interrupt.

group.name: UART Examples
group.desc: Send and Recieve Data on the UART Interfaces.

example.name: UART Example 1
example.desc: Echo back characters received on the UART.

example.name: UART Example 2
example.desc: Echo back characters received on the UART using interrupts.

example.name: UART Example 3
example.desc: Echo back characters received on the UART using a FIFO.

example.name: UART Example 4
example.desc: Echo back characters received on the UART using auto-flow control modes.

example.name: UART 9Bit Mode Example
example.desc: Loop back characters between UARTs in 9-bit mode.

group.name: USB Device Examples
group.desc: Examples for the USB Device Interface.

example.name: USBD Example BOMS to SDcard
example.desc: Implement a BOMS device (Flash disk) on the USB bridged to the file system on an SD card.

example.name: USBD Example CDCACM
example.desc: Enumerate as a CDC device on the USB which supports the ACM protocol.

example.name: USBD Example HID
example.desc: Make a USB keyboard device appear on the host and send a series of key presses.

example.name: USBD Example HID Bridge
example.desc: A USB keyboard device that will send a series of key presses translated from UART input characters.

example.name: USBD Example Composite
example.desc: Demonstrate how to make a composite USB device.

group.name: USB Host Examples
group.desc: Examples for the USB Host Interface.

example.name: USBH Example BOMS
example.desc: Read a BOMS device (Flash disk) plugged into the USB host.

example.name: USBH Example CDCACM
example.desc: Connect to and send data to and from a CDC device on the USB.

example.name: USBH Example FT232
example.desc: Connect to and send data to and from an FT232 device on the USB.

example.name: USBH Example HID
example.desc: Find USB HIDs on the USB and display report data from the device.

example.name: USBH Example File System
example.desc: Reads a filesystem on an Flash disk. Writes, reads and deletes a file.

example.name: USBH Example Hub
example.desc: Finds devices connected to the USB and shows information about them.

example.name: Watchdog Example 1
example.desc: Test the different modes of the internal watchdog timer.
